cluster_classes.class_label: Sulfide and Acid Stress Cracking Mechanisms
cluster_classes.class_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals due to sulfide and acid environments, including sulfide stress cracking and polythionic acid stress corrosion cracking.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Cracking in sulfide and acid environments.

cluster_classes.class_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals due to environmental factors, including wet H2S environments and carbon steel weldments.

members.entity_description: Cracking of pressure vessels in environments containing wet hydrogen sulfide.

members.entity_name: environmental cracking of carbon steel weldments
members.entity_description: Cracking that occurs in carbon steel weldments due to environmental factors in corrosive environments.

cluster_classes.class_description: Cracking mechanisms in materials due to stress and corrosive environments, including stress corrosion cracking and environment assisted cracking.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Cracking due to stress and corrosive environments.

members.entity_description: A failure mechanism where cracks form in a material due to the combined effects of tensile stress and a corrosive environment.
Cracking of materials facilitated by environmental conditions.

cluster_classes.class_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals due to acid environments, including polythionic acid stress corrosion cracking.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Cracking in sulfide and acid environments.

members.entity_description: A type of corrosion that affects austenitic stainless steels and other austenitic alloys during shutdowns.

cluster_classes.class_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals caused by hydrogen and/or sulfide environments, including SOHIC, HIC, and sulfide stress cracking.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Cracking in hydrogen-exposed steel, often near welds.

members.entity_description: A type of cracking in steel caused by the presence of hydrogen and stress, often near welds, characterized by cracks aligned nearly perpendicular to stress.
Stepwise internal cracks in metal connecting hydrogen blisters, occurring without external stress.
A form of hydrogen embrittlement that occurs in metals exposed to sulfide environments.

args.new_name: Sulfide and Acid Stress Cracking Mechanisms
args.new_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals due to sulfide and acid environments, including sulfide stress cracking and polythionic acid stress corrosion cracking.
args.justification: Both classes cover acid and sulfide-induced cracking mechanisms, with overlapping scope and entity evidence (polythionic acid stress corrosion cracking and sulfide stress cracking); merging removes redundancy.
Entity 'sulfide stress cracking' fits better in the merged Sulfide and Acid Stress Cracking Mechanisms class, as it is a sulfide-induced cracking mechanism.
Assigns the correct Class_Group to the merged class for schema consistency.
Clarifies that this class covers general environmental cracking mechanisms, distinct from specific acid/sulfide/hydrogen-induced mechanisms.

args.new_name: Stress Corrosion and Environment Assisted Cracking Mechanisms
args.new_description: Cracking mechanisms in materials due to stress and corrosive environments, including stress corrosion cracking and environment assisted cracking.
args.justification: Refines the class label to better reflect the included entities and aligns with the Class_Group.

args.new_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals caused by hydrogen, including SOHIC and HIC.
args.justification: After reassigning 'sulfide stress cracking', this class is now focused on hydrogen-induced mechanisms (SOHIC, HIC); label and description updated for clarity.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes cover acid and sulfide-induced cracking mechanisms, with overlapping scope and entity evidence (polythionic acid stress corrosion cracking and sulfide stress cracking); merging removes redundancy.
Entity 'sulfide stress cracking' fits better in the merged Sulfide and Acid Stress Cracking Mechanisms class, as it is a sulfide-induced cracking mechanism.
Assigns the correct Class_Group to the merged class for schema consistency.
Clarifies that this class covers general environmental cracking mechanisms, distinct from specific acid/sulfide/hydrogen-induced mechanisms.

executed_decisions.new_name: Stress Corrosion and Environment Assisted Cracking Mechanisms
executed_decisions.new_description: Cracking mechanisms in materials due to stress and corrosive environments, including stress corrosion cracking and environment assisted cracking.
executed_decisions.justification: Refines the class label to better reflect the included entities and aligns with the Class_Group.

executed_decisions.new_description: Cracking mechanisms in metals caused by hydrogen, including SOHIC and HIC.
executed_decisions.justification: After reassigning 'sulfide stress cracking', this class is now focused on hydrogen-induced mechanisms (SOHIC, HIC); label and description updated for clarity.
